definition: god/spirit/demon/occult or supernatural entities in general

sentences.chinese: 可是，是哪位神靈的屁股呢？

sentences.english: Confucius is considered divine in many countries.
sentences.chinese: 孔子在許多國家被尊爲神靈。

sentences.english: Dragon is one of the most sacred figures in ancient folk tales of the Bai People.
sentences.chinese: 龍是古代白族民間傳說中最受崇拜的神靈之一。

sentences.english: Many of the Gods have fallen into a deep slumber.
sentences.chinese: 很多神靈已經陷於了深睡傍邊。

sentences.english: It also known as Kang Rinpoche, meaning Precious Jewel Snow Mountain in Tibetan.
sentences.chinese: “岡仁波齊”，藏語的意思是“神靈之山”。
梵天給予了他這一神靈保佑。

sentences.english: They said they would disturb the gods that dwelt in the upper air.
sentences.chinese: 他們說飛機會攪擾住在高空的神靈。

sentences.english: The east wind drifts and god sends down rain.
sentences.chinese: 杳冥冥兮羌晝晦，東風飄兮神靈雨。

sentences.english: The Great Spirit saw her, and was listening.
sentences.chinese: 偉大的神靈看到了她，並且聽到了她的心裏話。

sentences.english: This is all some beautiful spirit.
And the people bowed and prayed to the neon god they made.
sentences.chinese: 人們打躬作揖，向他們所創作的汽燈神靈祈禱。

sentences.english: People in many countries worshiped special deities intended to protect them from smallpox.
sentences.chinese: 在許多國家，人民祈拜特別神靈以求上天保佑。

sentences.english: They thought it was sacrilegious to hold it on Christmas Day.
sentences.chinese: 人們認爲在聖誕節舉行佳卡努，無疑是褻瀆神靈。

sentences.english: Ewok spiritualism has a wide pantheon of gods and spirits.
sentences.chinese: 伊沃克人的精神至上觀念裏有着各種各樣的神靈。

sentences.english: The barbarians defiled the church by using it as a stable .
sentences.chinese: 這些野蠻人褻瀆神靈，把教堂當馬房。

sentences.english: Temple was very small, but people from all the directions went there and kowtowed to the deities.
sentences.chinese: 廟雖小，但來四面八方的人們都來這兒向神靈朝拜。

definition: (of a supernatural or divine being) to appear/to make itself manifest
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
magic transformation performed by Daoist immortal/fig. to reveal/to enlighten
to pray/to pray for sth/to wish sth/prayer/wish
